page.title: 17Our Water in Cheshunt
page.content: We get our water supply from the Thames, the Lee and the New River. The water has germs. It is taken with chlorine gas then put in big tanks to be stored then pumped into big pipes and comes through our taps. We have to pay a bill twice a year. For a family that is about Â£80 a year. It costs 8p for 1000 gallons. A lot of water is used for having baths or showers and the toilets, and for drinking and for the garden in summer when it hasn't been raining. We asked the inspector how long he worked_ 35 hours a week starting at 7.30 in the morning. The man at the pumping station said that it went for 24 hours a day so someone has to work daytime and somebody at night. The big machines pump the water along canals and some are high and go down a sort of waterfall into a lower level. This stops flooding.
